posts.post_content:
Aside perhaps from Onslaught's [Polluted Delta](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Polluted Delta) cycle (and that didn't include the opposed-color pairs), I'm wondering if this is the first set of lands we've seen that can be argued to not be strictly inferior to the original [Tundra](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tundra) style, putting aside the whole situation of carrying basic land types. I say this on account of the kind of turn two situations we see...  
  
Plains + Tundra: can use WW or WU  
Plains + Mystic Gate: can use WW, WU, \*or\* UU  
  
Tundra's advantage is that it can produce colored mana right away, valuable for the very beginning of the game. Mystic Gate adds more color flex, valuable for the mid-game.
